items.title: 'My greatest blessings': Khawaja's emotional retirement message
items.description: Australia batter Usman Khawaja announces he will retire from international cricket after the fifth and final Ashes Test at the SCG, which starts on Sunday.

items.title: Khawaja's on-field brilliance pales in comparison to his true impact
items.description: Before his debut in 2011, Australia had never seen a cricketer like Usman Khawaja and, thanks to his work on and off the field, he'll be followed by plenty more.

items.title: Not a 'blip': Sydney and Melbourne property prices go into reverse
items.description: The red-hot Australian housing market is showing the first signs of easing since interest rates started rising in May 2022.

items.title: Australian injured as survivors blame sparklers for Swiss blaze that killed around 40
items.description: Swiss authorities say "a large number of young people" are among the casualties from a fire at the Crans-Montana ski resort, as work continues to identify "dozens" of dead bodies.

items.title: Lachie Neale steps down as Brisbane Lions co-captain
items.description: The club said the 32-year-old had made the decision following a "challenging personal period".

items.title: Breaking: Helen Burnet quits Tasmanian Greens to sit on crossbench
items.description: The Clark MP says she knows the decision "will be disappointing for some" but is necessary for her to be "effective" in parliament.

items.title: Landmark Easter Island map 'unlocks the mystery' of giant Moai heads
items.description: A study using 11,600 aerial drone photos to map a mountainous quarry in 3D reveals more about how the island's famed stone sentinels were created and moved to their final resting places.

items.title: Search continues for teenager, man missing off Sydney coast
items.description: The search has resumed for a teenager and a man missing off the Sydney coast in the wake of three drowning deaths over 24 hours.

items.title: Bernie Sanders swears in Zohran Mamdani with a word of warning
items.description: New York's new mayor, Zohran Mamdani, has vowed not to water down his ambitious agenda during an impassioned inauguration address outside City Hall. But is his vision achievable?

items.title: 'A hunger revolution': Inside the massive protests sweeping Iran
items.description: Protests spread from the capital Tehran to other cities and across demographics, with people demanding Iran's leaders end the country's clerical rule and hold free elections.

items.title: More than 100 business leaders call for Bondi attack royal commission
items.description: Former Reserve Bank governors and CEOs are among more than 130 business leaders and prominent Australians now calling for a Commonwealth royal commission in the wake of the Bondi Beach terror attack.

items.title: This crowded house sits on a huge property, but a second home is not allowed
items.description: The days when New South Wales councils decide if a second home or a granny flat is built on the state's largest properties could be numbered.

items.title: Friendly, bubbly Aboriginal mother mourned after death in custody
items.description: A remote outback town is searching for answers about why a “respectful, friendly and bubbly” Aboriginal mother died in the police watch house, more than 24 hours after her Christmas Day arrest.

items.title: Truck driver shortage puts squeeze on Australia's supply chain
items.description: Australia's road transport industry is facing a growing driver shortage driven by an aging workforce and limited recruitment of younger people.

items.title: Disaster in north-west Queensland not over yet, more rain forecast for tropical coast
items.description: Rain has hit saturation point in parts of northern Queensland as communities remain isolated and cattle are lost.

items.title: Why severe storms keep forming over Queensland's Darling Downs
items.description: Queensland's Darling Downs has recorded more severe storm warning days than any other region this season — and meteorologists say it is no coincidence.

items.title: Add these must-do regional festivals to your 2026 calendar
items.description: From pint-sized penny farthings to tuna tosses, a beer can regatta to the Running of the Sheep, there's a regional festival for everyone's interests.

items.title: This Melbourne suburb has been on the decline, but a new future beckons
items.description: Richmond's Victoria Street, once a buzzing area home to dozens of restaurants and grocers, has seen better days. What can be done to bring it back to its bustling best?

items.title: Getting inked may carry more risks than Mum's disapproval
items.description: While most people worry about the pain of tattooing, studies suggest that being inked — and removing ink if you change your mind — may increase the chance of health issues down the track.

items.title: People are lining up to witness a whale 'mugging' but what is it?
items.description: People normally try to avoid getting mugged, but when it comes to being mugged by humpback whales, sightseers are travelling to Queensland's whale-watching capital to witness this special event.

items.title: Gilchrist says 'encouraging signs' as Damien Martyn treated for meningitis
items.description: Adam Gilchrist says there are "positive signs" from recent tests on former state and national teammate Damien Martyn, who is in hospital due to meningitis.

items.title: The bizarre political-legal drama unfolding in SA’s South East
items.description: The lower house of South Australia's parliament has two representatives from the Limestone Coast. Both are now in custody.

items.title: Divers help free critically endangered grey nurse sharks from fishing gear
items.description: The Sea World Foundation teams up with divers to locate, catch and release tangled grey nurse sharks — often referred to as the "labradors of the sea", despite their toothy appearance.

items.title: Total fire ban compliance plea after blaze's devastating consequences
items.description: Authorities urge people to adhere to total fire ban warnings one year on from a man's "stupid, thoughtless, dumb act" to set alight a pile of leaves and leave it unattended.

items.title: Emergency services kept busy as hot weather downs trees
items.description: Hot weather has caused stressed trees to drop limbs, damaging property across South Australia and injuring one person so far this summer.
